verses.verse: And it came to pass, when the LORD<WH3068> would take up<WH5927> Elijah<WH452> into heaven<WH8064> by a whirlwind<WH5591>, that Elijah<WH452> went<WH3212> with Elisha<WH477> from Gilgal<WH1537>.

And the sons<WH1121> of the prophets<WH5030> that were at Beth-el<WH1008> came forth<WH3318> to Elisha<WH477>, and said<WH559> unto him, Knowest<WH3045> thou that the LORD<WH3068> will take away<WH3947> thy master<WH113> from thy head<WH7218> to day<WH3117>? And Elijah<WH452> said<WH559> unto him, Tarry<WH3427>, I pray thee, here; for the LORD<WH3068> hath sent<WH7971> me to Jordan<WH3383>. And he said<WH559>, As the LORD<WH3068> liveth<WH2416>, and as thy soul<WH5315> liveth<WH2416>, I will not leave<WH5800> thee. And they two<WH8147> went on<WH3212>.
And fifty<WH2572> men<WH376> of the sons<WH1121> of the prophets<WH5030> went<WH1980>, and stood<WH5975> to view<WH5048> afar off<WH7350>: and they two<WH8147> stood<WH5975> by Jordan<WH3383>.

And Elijah<WH452> took<WH3947> his mantle<WH155>, and wrapped it together<WH1563>, and smote<WH5221> the waters<WH4325>, and they were divided<WH2673> hither and thither, so that they two<WH8147> went over<WH5674> on dry<WH2724> ground.

¶ And it came to pass, when they were gone over<WH5674>, that Elijah<WH452> said<WH559> unto Elisha<WH477>, Ask<WH7592> what I shall do<WH6213> for thee, before I be taken away<WH3947> from thee. And Elisha<WH477> said<WH559>, I pray thee, let a double<WH8147> portion<WH6310> of thy spirit<WH7307> be upon me.
And he said<WH559>, Thou hast asked<WH7592> a hard thing<WH7185>: nevertheless, if thou see<WH7200> me when I am taken<WH3947> from thee, it shall be so unto thee; but if not, it shall not be so.

And it came to pass, as they still<WH1980> went on<WH1980>, and talked<WH1696>, that, behold, there appeared a chariot<WH7393> of fire<WH784>, and horses<WH5483> of fire<WH784>, and parted<WH6504> them both<WH8147> asunder<WH996>; and Elijah<WH452> went up<WH5927> by a whirlwind<WH5591> into heaven<WH8064>.

¶ And Elisha<WH477> saw<WH7200> it, and he cried<WH6817>, My father<WH1>, my father<WH1>, the chariot<WH7393> of Israel<WH3478>, and the horsemen<WH6571> thereof. And he saw<WH7200> him no more: and he took hold<WH2388> of his own clothes<WH899>, and rent<WH7167> them in two<WH8147> pieces<WH7168>.
He took up<WH7311> also the mantle<WH155> of Elijah<WH452> that fell<WH5307> from him, and went back<WH7725>, and stood<WH5975> by the bank<WH8193> of Jordan<WH3383>;

And when the sons<WH1121> of the prophets<WH5030> which were to view at Jericho<WH3405> saw<WH7200> him, they said<WH559>, The spirit<WH7307> of Elijah<WH452> doth rest<WH5117> on Elisha<WH477>. And they came<WH935> to meet<WH7125> him, and bowed<WH7812> themselves to the ground<WH776> before him.

¶ And they said<WH559> unto him, Behold now, there be<WH3426> with thy servants<WH5650> fifty<WH2572> strong<WH2428> men<WH1121><WH582>; let them go<WH3212>, we pray thee, and seek<WH1245> thy master<WH113>: lest peradventure the Spirit<WH7307> of the LORD<WH3068> hath taken him up<WH5375>, and cast<WH7993> him upon some<WH259> mountain<WH2022>, or into some<WH259> valley<WH1516>. And when they urged<WH6484> him till he was ashamed<WH954>, he said<WH559>, Send<WH7971>. They sent<WH7971> therefore fifty<WH2572> men<WH376>; and they sought<WH1245> three<WH7969> days<WH3117>, but found<WH4672> him not.
And when they came again<WH7725> to him, (for he tarried<WH3427> at Jericho<WH3405>,) he said<WH559> unto them, Did I not say<WH559> unto you, Go<WH3212> not?

¶ And the men<WH582> of the city<WH5892> said<WH559> unto Elisha<WH477>, Behold, I pray thee, the situation<WH4186> of this city<WH5892> is pleasant<WH2896>, as my lord<WH113> seeth<WH7200>: but the water<WH4325> is naught<WH7451>, and the ground<WH776> barren<WH7921>.
And he said<WH559>, Bring<WH3947> me a new<WH2319> cruse<WH6746>, and put<WH7760> salt<WH4417> therein. And they brought<WH3947> it to him.

And he went forth<WH3318> unto the spring<WH4161> of the waters<WH4325>, and cast<WH7993> the salt<WH4417> in there, and said<WH559>, Thus saith<WH559> the LORD<WH3068>, I have healed<WH7495> these waters<WH4325>; there shall not be from thence any more death<WH4194> or barren<WH7921> land.
So the waters<WH4325> were healed<WH7495> unto this day<WH3117>, according to the saying<WH1697> of Elisha<WH477> which he spake<WH1696>.

¶ And he went up<WH5927> from thence unto Beth-el<WH1008>: and as he was going up<WH5927> by the way<WH1870>, there came forth<WH3318> little<WH6996> children<WH5288> out of the city<WH5892>, and mocked<WH7046> him, and said<WH559> unto him, Go up<WH5927>, thou bald head<WH7142>; go up<WH5927>, thou bald head<WH7142>.

And he turned<WH6437> back<WH310>, and looked<WH7200> on them, and cursed<WH7043> them in the name<WH8034> of the LORD<WH3068>. And there came forth<WH3318> two<WH8147> she bears<WH1677> out of the wood<WH3293>, and tare<WH1234> forty<WH705> and two<WH8147> children<WH3206> of them.
And he went<WH3212> from thence to mount<WH2022> Carmel<WH3760>, and from thence he returned<WH7725> to Samaria<WH8111>.
